results.title: David Fincher, the Unhappiest Auteur
results.abstract: The director makes beautiful bummers in an industry that prefers happy endings. Perhaps that’s why his movies seem like an endangered species.

results.title: This Year Was a Disaster. We Hope the Sequel Is Better.
results.abstract: We streamed, we watched, we worried. We also wondered what the catastrophe called 2020 will mean for movies.

multimedia.caption: “Pieces of a Woman,” which debuts Jan. 7 on Netflix, is the first lead film role for the actress Vanessa Kirby.

results.abstract: For her first lead in a film, the actress wanted a character as challenging as many of those she’s played onstage. She found it in Kornel Mundruczo’s “Pieces of a Woman.”
results.title: Vanessa Kirby Has Been Waiting for a Role That Scares Her
11 Things Our Critics Are Looking Forward to in 2021
results.abstract: Nicolas Cage hosts the history of swearing. Lorde writes a book and Julie Mehretu takes over the Whitney. This new year has to be better, right?
An assessment of the actor’s late-career B-movie filmography, including his most recent entry, “Breach.”
results.title: The Bruce Willis Journey From In Demand to On Demand
She’s Starring Opposite Tom Hanks. She’d Never Heard of Him.
results.abstract: Helena Zengel is a giggly, chatty 12-year-old, whose movie roles take her into psychological territory that even adults would find tough.

multimedia.caption: Helena Zengel in Berlin on Dec. 17. “I stand in front of the camera, I know what I want, and I do it,” she said.

results.title: Jazz Onscreen, Depicted by Black Filmmakers at Last
results.abstract: “Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom,” “Sylvie’s Love” and “Soul” understand the music and its place in African-American life, a welcome break with Hollywood history.

results.title: Wonder Woman and Her Evolving Look
results.abstract: She remained steadfast in her decades-long fight for justice, but her costumes ranged from a golden-eagle emblem and skirt to a W logo breastplate and leggings.

results.title: Joe Clark, Tough Principal at New Jersey High School, Dies at 82
results.abstract: Bullhorn in hand, he roamed the hallways as he imposed discipline, expelling “miscreants” and restoring order. Morgan Freeman portrayed him in the film “Lean on Me.”
